apis.description:
Returns the rubric with the given id.

Unfortuantely this endpoint does not return a standard Rubric object,
instead it returns a hash that looks like
  { 'rubric': Rubric, 'rubric_association': RubricAssociation }

This may eventually be deprecated in favor of a more standardized return
value, but that is not currently planned.

operations.notes:
Returns the rubric with the given id.

Unfortuantely this endpoint does not return a standard Rubric object,
instead it returns a hash that looks like
  { 'rubric': Rubric, 'rubric_association': RubricAssociation }

This may eventually be deprecated in favor of a more standardized return
value, but that is not currently planned.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the rubric

parameters.name: rubric_association_id
parameters.description: The id of the object with which this rubric is associated

parameters.name: rubric[title]
parameters.description: The title of the rubric

parameters.name: rubric[free_form_criterion_comments]
parameters.description: Whether or not you can write custom comments in the ratings field for a rubric

parameters.name: rubric_association[association_id]
parameters.description: The id of the object with which this rubric is associated

parameters.name: rubric_association[association_type]
parameters.description: The type of object this rubric is associated with

parameters.name: rubric_association[use_for_grading]
parameters.description: Whether or not the associated rubric is used for grade calculation

parameters.name: rubric_association[hide_score_total]
parameters.description:
Whether or not the score total is displayed within the rubric.
This option is only available if the rubric is not used for grading.

parameters.name: rubric_association[purpose]
parameters.description:
Whether or not the association is for grading (and thus linked to an assignment)
or if it's to indicate the rubric should appear in its context

parameters.name: rubric[criteria]
parameters.description: An indexed Hash of RubricCriteria objects where the keys are integer ids and the values are the RubricCriteria objects

parameters.name: include

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Applicable only if assessments are being returned. If included, returns either all criteria data associated with the assessment, or just the comments. If not included, both data and comments are omitted.

apis.description: Returns the rubric with the given id.

operations.notes: Returns the rubric with the given id.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Related records to include in the response.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Applicable only if assessments are being returned. If included, returns either all criteria data associated with the assessment, or just the comments. If not included, both data and comments are omitted.

apis.description:
Returns the rubric assessment with the given id.
The returned object also provides the information of
  :ratings, :assessor_name, :related_group_submissions_and_assessments, :artifact

operations.notes:
Returns the rubric assessment with the given id.
The returned object also provides the information of
  :ratings, :assessor_name, :related_group_submissions_and_assessments, :artifact

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: The id of the course

parameters.name: rubric_association_id
parameters.description: The id of the object with which this rubric assessment is associated

parameters.name: provisional
parameters.description: (optional) Indicates whether this assessment is provisional, defaults to false.

parameters.name: final
parameters.description: (optional) Indicates a provisional grade will be marked as final. It only takes effect if the provisional param is passed as true. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: graded_anonymously
parameters.description: (optional) Defaults to false

parameters.name: rubric_assessment
parameters.description:
A Hash of data to complement the rubric assessment:
The user id that refers to the person being assessed
  rubric_assessment[user_id]
Assessment type. There are only three valid types:  'grading', 'peer_review', or 'provisional_grade'
  rubric_assessment[assessment_type]
The points awarded for this row.
  rubric_assessment[criterion_id][points]
Comments to add for this row.
  rubric_assessment[criterion_id][comments]
For each criterion_id, change the id by the criterion number, ex: criterion_123
If the criterion_id is not specified it defaults to false, and nothing is updated.

apis.description: Delete the RubricAssociation with the given ID

operations.notes: Delete the RubricAssociation with the given ID

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

free_form_criterion_comments.description: whether or not free-form comments are used

data.description: An array with all of this Rubric's grading Criteria

assessments.description: If an assessment type is included in the 'include' parameter, includes an array of rubric assessment objects for a given rubric, based on the assessment type requested. If the user does not request an assessment type this key will be absent.

associations.description: If an association type is included in the 'include' parameter, includes an array of rubric association objects for a given rubric, based on the association type requested. If the user does not request an association type this key will be absent.

ratings.description: the possible ratings for this Criterion

rubric_id.description: the rubric the assessment belongs to

artifact_id.description: the id of the object of the assessment

artifact_attempt.description: the current number of attempts made on the object of the assessment

assessment_type.description: the type of assessment. values will be either 'grading', 'peer_review', or 'provisional_grade'

assessor_id.description: user id of the person who made the assessment

data.description: (Optional) If 'full' is included in the 'style' parameter, returned assessments will have their full details contained in their data hash. If the user does not request a style, this key will be absent.

comments.description: (Optional) If 'comments_only' is included in the 'style' parameter, returned assessments will include only the comments portion of their data hash. If the user does not request a style, this key will be absent.

association_id.description: the ID of the object this association links to

association_type.description: the type of object this association links to

use_for_grading.description: Whether or not the associated rubric is used for grade calculation

purpose.description: Whether or not the association is for grading (and thus linked to an assignment) or if it's to indicate the rubric should appear in its context. Values will be grading or bookmark.

hide_score_total.description: Whether or not the score total is displayed within the rubric. This option is only available if the rubric is not used for grading.
